15.title: Architecture Overview
15.excerpt: This document provides a high-level overview of the architecture of the Inference Gateway. The Inference-Gateway is designed to be modular and extensible, allowing easy integration of new models and providers.

16.title: Authentication
16.excerpt: Inference Gateway supports authentication through OpenID Connect (OIDC), allowing you to secure your API with various identity providers. This guide focuses on setting up authentication with Keycloak, a popular open-source identity and access management solution.

47.title: Inference Gateway CLI
47.excerpt: The Inference Gateway CLI (`infer`) is a powerful Go-based command-line tool that provides comprehensive access to the Inference Gateway. It features interactive chat, autonomous agent capabilities, extensive tool integration, and advanced conversation management.

50.title: Agent-To-Agent (A2A) Integration
50.excerpt: The Inference Gateway now supports **Agent-To-Agent (A2A)** integration, enabling Large Language Models (LLMs) to seamlessly coordinate with external specialized agents. This powerful feature allows LLMs to access and utilize a wide range of external tools and services through standardized agent interfaces.

8080.title: Model Context Protocol (MCP) Integration
8080.excerpt: The Inference Gateway supports **Model Context Protocol (MCP)** integration, enabling seamless access to external tools and data sources for Large Language Models (LLMs). This powerful feature automatically discovers and provides tools to LLMs without requiring clients to manage them individually.

This powerful feature allows LLMs to access and utilize a wide range of external tools and services through standardized agent interfaces.

google.title: Supported Providers
google.excerpt: Inference Gateway provides a unified interface to interact with multiple LLM providers.

hello.title: Getting Started

hello.title: Model Context Protocol (MCP) Integration
hello.excerpt: The Inference Gateway supports **Model Context Protocol (MCP)** integration, enabling seamless access to external tools and data sources for Large Language Models (LLMs). api.title: API Reference
api.excerpt: Inference Gateway provides a RESTful API for interacting with language models from various providers.

api.title: Architecture Overview
api.excerpt: This document provides a high-level overview of the architecture of the Inference Gateway. The Inference-Gateway is designed to be modular and extensible, allowing easy integration of new models and providers.

api.title: Authentication
api.excerpt: Inference Gateway supports authentication through OpenID Connect (OIDC), allowing you to secure your API with various identity providers. This guide focuses on setting up authentication with Keycloak, a popular open-source identity and access management solution.

api.title: Deployment with Helm
api.excerpt: This guide explains how to deploy the Inference Gateway using the official Helm charts.

api.title: Examples
api.excerpt: This page provides examples of how to use Inference Gateway in various scenarios and environments.

api.title: Integrated Development Environments (IDEs)
api.excerpt: Inference Gateway is fully OpenAI-compatible, allowing you to configure it with your favorite IDEs and extensions using standard OpenAI integration settings. The following sections provide instructions for configuring popular IDEs and extensions.

api.title: Inference Gateway Documentation
api.excerpt: Inference Gateway is a proxy server designed to facilitate access to various

api.title: Software Development Kits (SDK's)
api.excerpt: Inference Gateway provides official SDKs for various programming languages to simplify integration with your applications. These SDKs offer typed interfaces, error handling, and convenience methods for interacting with the Inference Gateway API.

api.title: Supported Providers
api.excerpt: Inference Gateway provides a unified interface to interact with multiple LLM providers.

usage.title: Agent-To-Agent (A2A) Integration
usage.excerpt: The Inference Gateway now supports **Agent-To-Agent (A2A)** integration, enabling Large Language Models (LLMs) to seamlessly coordinate with external specialized agents. This powerful feature allows LLMs to access and utilize a wide range of external tools and services through standardized agent interfaces.

usage.title: API Reference
usage.excerpt: Inference Gateway provides a RESTful API for interacting with language models from various providers.

usage.title: Inference Gateway CLI
usage.excerpt: The Inference Gateway CLI (`infer`) is a powerful Go-based command-line tool that provides comprehensive access to the Inference Gateway. It features interactive chat, autonomous agent capabilities, extensive tool integration, and advanced conversation management.

usage.title: Examples
usage.excerpt: This page provides examples of how to use Inference Gateway in various scenarios and environments.

usage.title: Getting Started
usage.excerpt: Learn how to install and set up Inference Gateway.

usage.title: Model Context Protocol (MCP) Integration
usage.excerpt: The Inference Gateway supports **Model Context Protocol (MCP)** integration, enabling seamless access to external tools and data sources for Large Language Models (LLMs). This powerful feature automatically discovers and provides tools to LLMs without requiring clients to manage them individually.

usage.title: Supported Providers
usage.excerpt: Inference Gateway provides a unified interface to interact with multiple LLM providers.

usage.title: User Interface (UI)
usage.excerpt: Inference Gateway includes an optional web-based user interface for interactively testing and exploring the various language model providers and capabilities.

name.excerpt: Inference Gateway supports authentication through OpenID Connect (OIDC), allowing you to secure your API with various identity providers. This guide focuses on setting up authentication with Keycloak, a popular open-source identity and access management solution.

name.title: Deployment with Helm
name.excerpt: This guide explains how to deploy the Inference Gateway using the official Helm charts.

name.title: Examples
name.excerpt: This page provides examples of how to use Inference Gateway in various scenarios and environments.

name.title: Integrated Development Environments (IDEs)
name.excerpt: Inference Gateway is fully OpenAI-compatible, allowing you to configure it with your favorite IDEs and extensions using standard OpenAI integration settings. The following sections provide instructions for configuring popular IDEs and extensions.

name.title: Observability
name.excerpt: Inference Gateway provides robust observability features to help monitor and troubleshoot your deployment. These features include metrics collection, tracing, and logging capabilities that integrate with popular monitoring tools.

messages.title: API Reference
messages.excerpt: Inference Gateway provides a RESTful API for interacting with language models from various providers.

messages.title: Examples

messages.title: Getting Started
messages.excerpt: Learn how to install and set up Inference Gateway.

messages.title: Inference Gateway Documentation
messages.excerpt: Inference Gateway is a proxy server designed to facilitate access to various

messages.title: Model Context Protocol (MCP) Integration
messages.excerpt: The Inference Gateway supports **Model Context Protocol (MCP)** integration, enabling seamless access to external tools and data sources for Large Language Models (LLMs). This powerful feature automatically discovers and provides tools to LLMs without requiring clients to manage them individually.

messages.title: Supported Providers
messages.excerpt: Inference Gateway provides a unified interface to interact with multiple LLM providers.

messages.title: User Interface (UI)
messages.excerpt: Inference Gateway includes an optional web-based user interface for interactively testing and exploring the various language model providers and capabilities.

https.excerpt: Inference Gateway is a proxy server designed to facilitate access to various

https.title: Model Context Protocol (MCP) Integration
https.excerpt: The Inference Gateway supports **Model Context Protocol (MCP)** integration, enabling seamless access to external tools and data sources for Large Language Models (LLMs). This powerful feature automatically discovers and provides tools to LLMs without requiring clients to manage them individually.

https.title: Observability
https.excerpt: Inference Gateway provides robust observability features to help monitor and troubleshoot your deployment. These features include metrics collection, tracing, and logging capabilities that integrate with popular monitoring tools.

https.title: Software Development Kits (SDK's)
https.excerpt: Inference Gateway provides official SDKs for various programming languages to simplify integration with your applications. These SDKs offer typed interfaces, error handling, and convenience methods for interacting with the Inference Gateway API.

https.title: Supported Providers
https.excerpt: Inference Gateway provides a unified interface to interact with multiple LLM providers.

https.title: User Interface (UI)
https.excerpt: Inference Gateway includes an optional web-based user interface for interactively testing and exploring the various language model providers and capabilities.

install.title: Integrated Development Environments (IDEs)
install.excerpt: Inference Gateway is fully OpenAI-compatible, allowing you to configure it with your favorite IDEs and extensions using standard OpenAI integration settings. The following sections provide instructions for configuring popular IDEs and extensions.

install.title: Inference Gateway Documentation
install.excerpt: Inference Gateway is a proxy server designed to facilitate access to various

install.title: Observability
install.excerpt: Inference Gateway provides robust observability features to help monitor and troubleshoot your deployment. These features include metrics collection, tracing, and logging capabilities that integrate with popular monitoring tools.

install.title: Software Development Kits (SDK's)
install.excerpt: Inference Gateway provides official SDKs for various programming languages to simplify integration with your applications. These SDKs offer typed interfaces, error handling, and convenience methods for interacting with the Inference Gateway API.

official.title: Authentication
official.excerpt: Inference Gateway supports authentication through OpenID Connect (OIDC), allowing you to secure your API with various identity providers. This guide focuses on setting up authentication with Keycloak, a popular open-source identity and access management solution.

official.title: Deployment with Helm
official.excerpt: This guide explains how to deploy the Inference Gateway using the official Helm charts.

official.title: Examples
official.excerpt: This page provides examples of how to use Inference Gateway in various scenarios and environments.

execution.title: Model Context Protocol (MCP) Integration

full.excerpt: The Inference Gateway supports **Model Context Protocol (MCP)** integration, enabling seamless access to external tools and data sources for Large Language Models (LLMs). This powerful feature automatically discovers and provides tools to LLMs without requiring clients to manage them individually.
